intro: Syngonanthus acephalus, commonly known as the dwarf poinsettia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It is characterized by its striking red bracts that surround small, inconspicuous yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with unique floral structures. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Syngonanthus acephalus is often cultivated as a decorative plant, especially during the holiday season.
